Sentencas: Proton-conducting electrolytes are receiving increasing attention due to their high ionic conductivity at intermediate temperatures, enabling the operation of solid oxide cells with high energy efficiency at low cost.
Titulo: Critical role of acceptor dopants in designing highly stable and compatible proton-conducting electrolytes for reversible solid oxide cells

Sentencas: However, the effect of B-site dopants on the properties of doped barium hafnate-cerate electrolyte materials, especially in single cells under operating conditions, has not been systematically studied.
Titulo: Critical role of acceptor dopants in designing highly stable and compatible proton-conducting electrolytes for reversible solid oxide cells

Sentencas: Here we report our findings in the development of a series of proton-conducting electrolytes with a general formula of BaHf0.1Ce0.7R0.2O3-delta (BHCR172, R = Yb, Er, Y, Gd, Sm).
Titulo: Critical role of acceptor dopants in designing highly stable and compatible proton-conducting electrolytes for reversible solid oxide cells

Sentencas: The results reveal that electrical conductivity, ionic transference number, chemical stability against steam and CO2, and compatibility with NiO during sintering are all closely correlated with the dopant size.
Titulo: Critical role of acceptor dopants in designing highly stable and compatible proton-conducting electrolytes for reversible solid oxide cells

Sentencas: In particular, the reaction with NiO is found to strongly affect the properties of the electrolytes and hence cell performance.
Titulo: Critical role of acceptor dopants in designing highly stable and compatible proton-conducting electrolytes for reversible solid oxide cells

Sentencas: Among all tested compositions, BaHf0.1Ce0.7Yb0.2O3-delta (BHCYb172) shows excellent chemical stability and minimal reactivity towards NiO, as predicted from density functional theory (DFT)-based calculations and confirmed by experimental results.
Titulo: Critical role of acceptor dopants in designing highly stable and compatible proton-conducting electrolytes for reversible solid oxide cells

Sentencas: In addition, proton-conducting reversible solid oxide cells (P-ReSOCs) based on the optimized electrolyte composition, BHCYb172, demonstrate exceptional performance and stability, achieving a remarkable peak power density of 1.74 W cm(-2) (O-2 as the oxidant) at 600 degrees C in the fuel cell mode and a high current density of 2.0 A cm(-2) at 1.3 V and 600 degrees C in the steam electrolysis mode while maintaining excellent durability for over 1000 h.
Titulo: Critical role of acceptor dopants in designing highly stable and compatible proton-conducting electrolytes for reversible solid oxide cells
